title: 2D motion - expression for velocity of a river

content.question: The water in a river moves uniformly to the east with speed <math alttext="v sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>r</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, as shown. A boat on the river starts from the south edge of the river and the boat’s motor gives the boat a constant speed of <math alttext="v sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>b</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> to the north relative to the water. The width of the river is <math alttext="w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>w</mi></math>. When the boat reaches the north edge of the river, it has an eastward displacement of <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></math> relative to its starting position. Which of the following expressions is equal to <math alttext="v sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>r</mtext></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of v sub b, end sub, squared, plus 2 a delta x, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mtext>b</mtext><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of w squared, plus, open parenthesis, delta x, close parenthesis, squared, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mrow><msup><mi>w</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta x times v sub b, and denominator w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>b</mtext></msub></mrow><mi>w</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the inverse tangent of, the fraction with numerator w, and denominator delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msup><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>w</mi><mrow><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta x times v sub b, and denominator w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>b</mtext></msub></mrow><mi>w</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 1.5: Vectors and Motion in Two Dimensions

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
